content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the potential response "I don't know. I would like to know what the new employees are called." is highly engaging. It shows a genuine interest in the conversation and a desire to learn more. This response can also serve as a conversation starter for the moderator to provide more information on the topic. Moreover, it is a natural response that reflects the curiosity of the speaker. 

In contrast, the negative side might argue that the response is not relevant to the current conversation topic. However, as the moderator has already switched the topic to science, any response to the new topic is valid. Therefore, this response is not only engaging but also appropriate in the given context.

In summary, the potential response is an excellent example of an engaging response because it shows interest, curiosity, and naturally flows with the conversation.

: Thank you for your argument, but I must disagree. While it is true that the potential response shows a desire to learn more, it does not add any value to the current conversation. As you mentioned, the topic has already been switched to science, and the fact presented is about new google employees. The potential response does not relate to either of these topics and does not contribute to the conversation in any meaningful way.

Furthermore, the potential response is quite generic and lacks creativity. It does not show any personal connection to the topic or provide any unique insights. It is merely a statement of a desire for information, which can be seen as a lack of engagement rather than the opposite.

Therefore, I argue that the potential response is not engaging because it is not relevant, adds no value to the conversation, and lacks creativity.

[Rebuttal]: Thank you for your response, but I respectfully disagree. While it is true that the potential response does not directly relate to the current conversation topic, it does not necessarily mean that it does not add value. As I mentioned earlier, the response can serve as a conversation starter for the moderator to provide more information on the topic of new google employees, which can potentially lead to a more engaging discussion.

Moreover, I believe that the potential response's simplicity and naturalness are precisely what make it engaging. It reflects the speaker's genuine interest in learning more and can, therefore, encourage the other participants to share their knowledge and insights on the topic. Sometimes, the most engaging responses are the ones that spark curiosity and encourage others to speak up.

In conclusion, I believe that the potential response is engaging because it can potentially lead to a more engaging discussion, reflects the speaker's genuine curiosity, and encourages others to share their knowledge and insights.

topic_chat_history:
did you see crazy rich asians ? 
 no i have n't . i heard it was good . 
 i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy . 
 my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ? 
 it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background . 
 if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director . 
 yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film . 
 the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 . 
 that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen . 
 well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life . 
 i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat . 
 this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us . 
 that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ? 
 it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth . 
 i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long . 
 i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada . 
 i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .
topic_chat_fact: new google employees are called ' nooglers ' and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first friday .
topic_chat_response: i do n't know . i would like to know what the new employees are called .
